gurmukhi: ਦਿਨ ਕੈਕ ਗੲੇ || ਦਿਨ ਭੂਰ ਜੲੇ || ਤਨ ਕੳੁਚ ਧਰੇ || ਸਸਿ ਸੋਭ ਹਰੇ ||੩੪||
transliteration: Din Kail Gad|| Din Bhoor Jae|| Tan Kaouch Ddare|| Sas(i) Sobh Dare||34||
translation: Many days passed, when she gave birth to a child, who was wearing armour on his body and was also the abductor of moon’s beauty.34.

gurmukhi: ਜਨੁ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ ਦਵਾ || ਅਸਤੇਜ ਭਵਾ || ਰਿਖ ਜੌਨ ਪਿਖੈ || ਚਿਤ ਚੳੁਕ ਚਕੈ ||੩੫||
transliteration: Jan(u) Jvaal Davaa|| Astej Bhavaa|| Rikh Jaoun Pikhai|| Chit Chaouk Chakai||35||
translation: His splendour was like the forest-fire; whosoever saw him, he was wonder-struck.35.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਸ ਸਯਾਨ ਭਯੋ || ਕਰਿ ਸੰਗ ਲਯੋ || ਚਲ ਅਾਵ ਤਹਾਂ || ਤਿਹ ਤਾਤ ਜਹਾਂ ||੩੬||
transliteration: Sis Syaan Bhayo|| Kar(i) San Layo|| Chal Aav Tahan|| Tih Taat Jahaan||36||
translation: When the child grew a bit older, she (the mother) took him there where his father was.36.

gurmukhi: ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਦੇਖ ਜਬੈ || ਕਰਿ ਲਾਜ ਤਬੈ || ਯਹ ਮੋਨ ਸੂਅੰ || ਤ੍ਰੀਅੰ ਕੌਨ ਤੂਅੰ ||੩੭||
transliteration: Nrip Dekh Jabai|| Kar(i) Laaj Tabai|| Yah Mon Sooan|| Treean Kaoun Tootan||37||
translation: When the king saw her, he hesitated a little and asked her ”O” woman, who are you and who is this boy?”37.
Speech of the woman addressed to the king:

gurmukhi: ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਨਾਰ ਸੁੲੀ || ਤੁਮ ਜੌਨ ਭਜੀ || ਮਧ ਪਰਨ ਕੁਟੀ || ਤਹ ਕੇਲ ਠਟੀ ||੩੮||
transliteration: Nrip Naar Suee|| Toum Jaoun Bhajee|| Madh Paran Koutee|| Tah Kel Thatee||38||
translation: “O king ! I am the same woman, with whom you had had sexual enjoyment in the forest-cottage.38.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਬਾਚ ਦੀਯੋ || ਅਬ ਭੂਲ ਗਯੋ || ਤਿਸ ਚਿੱਤ ਕਰੋ || ਮੁਹਿ ਰਾਜ ਬਰੋ ||੩੯||
transliteration: Tah Baach Deeyo|| Ah Bhool Gado|| Tis Chitt Daro || Muhe Raaj Bado||39||
translation: “then you had given your word now you have forgotten; O king ! remember that promise and now own me.39.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਕਾਹਿ ਭਜੋ || ਅਬ ਮੋਹਿ ਤਜੋ || ੲਿਹ ਪੁਤ੍ਰ ਤੁਅੰ || ਸੁਨ ਸਾਚ ਨ੍ਰਿਪੰ ||੪੦||
transliteration: Tab Kaah(i) Bhajo|| Ab Moh(i) Tajo|| Eh Poutra Toutan|| Soun Saach Nripan||40||
translation: “If now you are forsaking me, then why did you own me at that time? O king! I am saying the truth that he is your son.40.

gurmukhi: ਨਹੀ ਸ੍ਰਾਪ ਤੁਝੈ || ਭਜ ਕੈਬ ਮੁਝੈ || ਅਬ ਤੋ ਨ ਤਜੋ || ਨਹੀ ਲਾਜ ਲਜੋ ||੪੧||
transliteration: Nahisraap Tujhai|| Bhaj Kaib Mujhai|| Ab To Na Tajo|| Nahilaaj Lajo||41||
translation: “If you will not wed me, then I shall curse you, therefore now do not forsake me and do not feel shy.”41.
Speech of the king addressed to the woman;

gurmukhi: ਕੋੲੀ ਚਿੰਨ ਬਤਾੳੁ || ਕਿ ਬਾਤ ਦਿਖਾੳੁ || ਕਹਿ ਯੌ ਨ ਭਜੋ || ਨਹਿ ਨਾਰ ਲਜੋ ||੪੨||
transliteration: Koichinn Bataao|| Ki Baat Dikhaao|| Kah(i) Yaoun Na Bhajo|| Nah(i) Naar Lajo||42||
translation: " You may tell me some sign or saying, otherwise I shall not wed You; O woman! Do not forsake your shyness" 42.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਮੁਦ੍ਰਕ ਲੈ || ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਕੈ ਕਰਿ ਦੈ || ੲਿਹ ਦੇਖ ਭਲੇ || ਕਸ ਹੇਰ ਤਲੇ ||੪੩||
transliteration: Ik Mudrak Lai|| Nrip Kai Kar(i) Dai|| Eh Dekh Bhale|| Kas Her Tale||43||
translation: Sakuntla placed a gold coin on the hand of the king and said, " You look at it and remember." 43.

gurmukhi: ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਜਾਨ ਗੲੇ || ਪਹਿਚਾਨ ਭੲੇ || ਤਬ ਤੳੁਨ ਬਰੀ || ਬਹੁ ਭਾਂਤ ਭਰੀ ||੪੪||
transliteration: Nrip Jaan Gad|| Paihchaan Bhae|| Tab Taoun Daree|| Bahu Bhaant Bharee||44||
translation: The king remembered all and recognised Shakuntala;Then the king solemnised his wedding with her and enjoyed her in various ways.44.
